name: Enrique Olvera
description: Enrique Olvera is a Mexican chef. He is the owner and head chef of Pujol, a Mexican haute cuisine restaurant in Mexico City, which is currently ranked 9th in the world according to the 2021 annual

recipes.cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mix together the pork, pineapple juice, achiote paste, oregano, and cumin. Marinate for at least 2 hours, or overnight. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the pork until browned and crispy, about 3-5 minutes per side. Serve in warm tortillas with chopped onion, cilantro, and lime wedges.

ingredients: 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely chopped
recipes.cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mash the avocados with a fork or a potato masher until they are mostly smooth but still slightly chunky. Stir in the red onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and lime juice. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.

Roast the peppers over an open flame or under the broiler until the skin is charred. Let cool, then peel off the skin and remove the seeds. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef and onion until the beef is browned and cooked through. Add the cooked rice and cheese, and stir until the cheese is melted. Stuff the peppers with the beef mixture and place them in a baking dish. Bake at 375°F for 15-20 minutes, or until heated through and the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
